comment: This professor grades fairly. He will give you feedback. I noticed that what I felt was a normal amount of words in a paper, he would like to see a lot more. Once I provided what he was looking for. I never got the feedback again. The class is in Java and you will need to use it throughout the class. The class is straight forward.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: He was alright. Since there were no other good professors for this class he was the best but that doesn't make him a great professor. His online class has 5 Assignments, 3 Quizzes, 2 Midterms, and a Final. It is tough to understand his lectures and he likes to talk very fast as well. Easier to read the PowerPoint. Decently easy B hard to fail.

He is very easy to access outside of class and understands students have outside problems; he moved one quiz for us and pushed back an assignment date for us too. He made review videos for tests/quizzes that are super helpful and I recommend studying the quizzes before the tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Shi grades very fairly, listens to student feedback, responds quickly to emails, and tries to ensure every student thoroughly understands the material. For that reason, he's an above average CS professor. However, given how easy CS3305 was, his slow and methodical teaching style made the class painfully boring. Overall, great guy.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Unorganized reads from the slides only. His first few assignments had lots of mistakes. Hard to understand but overall nice guy. Just wish he cared more as I don't think he enjoys his job very much. We did the class in Java so it was extremely easy and the class was boring.

Professor Shi explained the concepts of data structures very well. He shows many examples to explain the multiple conepts. There are a few coding assignments that are tough but you have a week to complete them. There are few tests and quizzes so be sure to study for them as they count a lot.

Incredibly unorganized. There was no schedule for the class, he would just randomly upload lectures and assignments. We had a final project along with a final research paper, both of which were due before finals week. Lectures are difficult to understand due to poor audio quality. He gives good grades, but they seem to be arbitrary.

This class was very chill. Show up the first couple weeks of class to get your tools set up and then you don't really need to show up after that. Everything was straight forward: 3 assignments, 3 tests, 1 project, and 1 presentation.

I'm not sure what I could say bad about the guy except for an obvious language barrier. He is legit my favorite teacher to take computing courses with. He doesn't mind explaining things, and he understands it so well he can really break it down for you. When I did my petition to graduate, this was the guy I put down as my best prof.

I had him for cloud computing and let me say, I didnt learn anything. The test were easy but the labs made no sense. Hes not really helpful either. I work full time and this class made my anxiety rise to the sky. Take him if you enjoy paying for a class and teaching yourself.

I'm not sure how Yong Shi is for an in person class, but he was great for this online course. His syllabus clearly laid out all the requirements and the work do each week was very manageable. The tests and quizzes weren't bad and he adjusted due dates a lot to accommodate students and the difficulty of the work.

The lectures recording can be a bit long. The assignments are sometimes hard to understand but easy to complete. Test and quizzes are easy for the most part if you look threw the power point or watch the lectures. Not the best at replying to questions. Usually tells you to ask one of his student assistants.

Professor Shi is a fairly average professor. Since this was an online class, he didn't participate with us much. The only lectures were him talking over some powerpoint slides. He was very test heavy, and nearly all of your grade is dependent on how well you can take a test. I'd only recommend if you can learn well on your own.

You will get a A if you have basic java knowledge with no effort at all, if you don't you may have to work a bit for the A. He gives lectures that cover the weekly lab and the weekly homework and if you get stuck during the lab he has a few assistants that can help you out. Highly recommended
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: So hes not the worst teacher. If you are new to Java and programming, this will be an extremely difficult course. He explains the slideshows and tries to teach but if no one is asking questions he may leave out important details that need to be clarified. LOTS of homework, be prepared for that. If you dont put in the hours you wont do well. Period.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Shi is awesome. I am currently taking him for Algorithm Analysis and he is very good at explaining fairly difficult concepts. You usually take data structures first which makes the course easier. No homework, 5 exams, and he's a fair grader in my opinion. Ask for help! He's willing. I wouldn't skip class though.

Only take him if you actually enjoy programming. I only managed to have a good time in that class due to my own choice to learn the course myself. This would be a tough class for those who rely heavily on professors to do good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Yong Shi assigns and incredible amount of homework that takes hours to complete every week, but this is understandable as this is a programming course and programming is best learned through repetition of the concepts. Test are quite difficult, being that it is all handwritten Java. You learn most of the material through online lectures.

He was pretty chill in the semester. Hybrid course is basically learn it yourself, and if you have trouble learning it yourself you better have the guts to ask questions a few days before assignments are due. Will help you if you go up to him and ask him something specific, and he can help with most confusions.

One of my favorite professors that I have had. The class I took was hybrid, and you had to watch the lectures before going to class. Professor Shi would always take the first few minutes to review the lecture to make sure everyone understood the topics. Sometimes a little hard to understand. Always willing to help anyone with a question if they ask

If one of your hobbies include failing I would take him but otherwise i would not take him. First off let me say that hybrid classes are the worst idea ever, you are just going to end up teaching yourself. In addition to that when you actually go to class all you do is labs but still come out feeling like you've learned nothing.

Hybrid data structures class - terrible, if you don't know c++ or don't have experience writing code. Loooong weekly labs and assignments. I spent more time on the c++ syntax than learning data structures. I ask a question - he says google it. The worst class I ever took

Hybrid classes for computer science are absolutely ridiculous because you  have to teach yourself the assignments.  The days you go to class are simply lab days.  Too hard to teach yourself.  This guy doesn't want to hear why you are late for any reason.  MIss or arrive late to his class, you get a 0.  It doesn't matter if you are in an accident.
He is nice-ish.  He doesnt take  attendance but I recommend to go to class. You have four test including the final.  You have labs.  But I pretty much learn by myself.
Take this guy.  3 easy tests that he basically gives you the answers to. No long hw, no attendance. One of the best, and a really nice guy too.

Took a  3hr class with this teacher and it bored me into tears. His English is okay you can get by. If he feels like you didn't write the program. He ask annoying questions like "did you write this". Then try to test you! Monday was lecture and Wednesday is lab. It was okay at first then it turn into a real pain. He makes programming complicate.
Best Class ever, took it over the Fall and got an A. You dont have to buy the text book but you might find a way to download it
Great Professor. very laid back, easy to talk to, more like a peer then a teacher. Take him!
Exams are long, come from the PowerPoint though but will be curved. He is a cool guy, engaging, knows his stuff, you will make an A if you attend and pay attention in class.

Prof.Yong is probably one of the most patient and good natured people I've ever met,he made the material easy to understand and the homework assignments were pretty fun! Make sure you go to each lecture then you should be able to pull out an A.

CS 2301 The lectures can be boring and long. He answers any questions you ask, and he provides test review material. He is pretty straight forward and relaxed. Tests are multiple choice with  a few programs you have to write out by hand on paper. Lectures go quick, attend class. Labs are medium hard. He has an accent. Can be hard for beginners.

I enjoyed his class. It was easy, but I still felt like I learned a bit from him. I would have liked it to be more difficult. Lectures are a little boring, but many lectures are. I would recommend him. If you understand english you should be able to understand his accent.

Great prof. I can see how some would think his lectures are boring but if you are interested in computer science its not that bad. There is no out of class work and one assignment per week in class that is relatively easy. The assignment is entirely based off of the lecture from the previous class. Prof. Shi has been one of my fac. professors.

His lectures are pretty boring and he has a hard time explaining concepts. He assigns homework but it's usually pretty easy. Tests were on the hard side but the questions are usually related to the homework, the slides, and the examples he gives in class. He allowed cheat sheets for tests. Be prepared to write out lots of code by hand.

Dr. Shi is more of an average professor. His assignments are relatively easy but I thought that some of them weren't all that relevant. Tests are multiple choice with written program sections, which is a little bit tedious but nothing too bad. He's got a bit of an accent but that's not his fault. He's not great but by no means is he a bad professor

Nice(ish) guy, but he has no idea whatsoever how to write a test. Two questions requiring six pages to hand-write programs were worth 10 points, while two irrelevant multiple choice questions on the same thing (that we didn't cover) were worth 4 points. Labs are easy, but he DOES grade attendance based on knowing faces. Avoid whenever possible.

Not that great of a teacher. Labs and homework are extremely easy. Too easy actually. I didn't really feel that I learned much at all in this class. Tests are multiple choice plus writing out a program by hand. It's tedious but if you look like you know what you're doing he will give you full credit. We never used the book. Don't bother buying it.
Not the best teacher, but fair enough. Study every single thing he puts on the powerpoints, because he will choose the most random little thing to make a 10 point question on the test.
This class was a breeze. Just listen in class, read the powerpoints and you will be fine. Shi is hard to understand but is getting better. The tests were easy and only one pop quiz all semester.

Dr Shi is a really great teacher. Ok his english isn't very good, but he will do his best to help you under better. This is a mandatory class for ISA and CSIS, so I seriously recommend taking him. The 1st exam is average, 2nd was murder, and 3rd was easy. GOOD LUCK!!!!!!!!!!!!

He gives pop quizs, but quizes do not reflect test. He has hard time speaking English, and goes slow. Everyone pretty much fails his tests, he will curve if average is 69 or below. He makes alot of mistakes when he is teaching, which causes me to get confused. Easy hw, hard test, and quizes. He is smart at what he knows, but is not a teacher.

Very hard to understand with his accent. Extremely boring and slow which caused me to fall asleep numerous times. I  resorted to the book more than anything just because he makes the material way more confusing then it really is. Some pop quizzes too and the hw was quite easy. The test are semi hard but he will curve if enough people fail.
Has difficulties with English. Makes thing waaaay more complicated than they need to be and ends up confusing himself and the class. Has issues with whiteboard markers...
